alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 21 at 6:25PM AKST until January 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Montana Creek in Juneau. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain and snowmelt in areas near the low water crossing on Montana Creek Road and near Back Loop Road at the Montana Creek bridge. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding, especially near Montana Creek. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.2-0.4 inches in 3 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible. - For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 6:00pm the stage was 15.54 feet. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.5 feet is expected around 3:00 pm Saturday. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Flood stage - 3-6 inches of water at low water crossing on Montana Creek Road - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
